newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for May 14.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for May 14.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open Wednesday to larger ships despite some strong winds in Gulf of Mexico, Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1000 local/1500 GMT daily meteorological report.
Ports were closed to smaller fishing and tourism ships at Veracruz and Puerto Penasco. The bulletin said that expectations of strong northern winds prompted the closures.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean.

Mostly clear skies with isolated showers along coasts of Michoacan, Oaxaca and Chiapas states. Maximum winds from 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 16 miles per hour) and waves three to five feet high.
Possible rains and maximum winds from the Caribbean of 10 to 15 knots and waves three to five feet high.
Hot and partly cloudy with some rains and winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
